business.headline: Sensex, Nifty erase Trump-fuelled gains as focus shifts to Fed rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 836.34 points to 79,541.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 284.70 points to settle at 24,199.35.
Trent share price falls 8% despite 47% rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyTrent share price: By 1:33 pm, the stock was down 7.49%, trading at Rs 6,432.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Elon Musk's net worth rises $26 billion in a day after Donald Trump's election victoryThe boost came as Tesla's shares climbed 14.75% to $288.53 during after-hours trading, with Trump's pro-business policies seen as a favorable backdrop for Tesla and Musk's ventures.

Jet Airways grounded for good as Supreme Court orders liquidationThe Supreme Court noted that five years had passed since the plan was approved, and there had been no significant progress in reviving the airline.

Ola Electric share price gains after 2 straight sessions. Here's whyOla Electric share price: The uptick in the stock price is attributed to Ola Electric's recent inclusion in the MSCI Small Cap Index.

Sensex drops 900 points as Trump euphoria fades, focus shifts to Fed rate decisionStock market today: Sensex and Nifty fell sharply during Thursday's intraday trading session as investors turned cautious ahead of the US Federal Reserve's rate decision.

Gold, silver price today, November 7, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today November 7, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Explained: Why Hindalco share price fell over 6% todayAt 10:25 am, Hindalco's share price was down 6.50%, trading at Rs 662.20.

US elections: Why renewable energy stocks tumbled after Donald Trump's win In his victory speech following the 2024 US presidential election, Donald Trump pledged to halt renewable energy projects from his first day in office.

Explained: Why Apollo Hospitals share price jumped 6% todayIn Q2FY25, Apollo Hospitals reported a 63% year-on-year (YoY) increase in net profit, reaching Rs 379 crore, mainly driven by growth in its hospital business. This is up from Rs 233 crore in the same quarter last year.

Sensex, Nifty open lower ahead of Fed rate decision; Apollo Hospitals jumps 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 107.15 points to 80,270.98 at 9:21 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 47.25 points to trade at 24,436.80.

S&P 500, Dow open at record high as Donald Trump wins; Tesla shares jump 13%The S&P 500 and Dow Jones surged, with the Dow gaining 628.5 points, or 1.49%, to reach 42,850.4 at the open, while the S&P 500 rose 82.1 points, or 1.42%, to 5,864.89. The Nasdaq Composite also climbed, adding 333.6 points, or 1.81%, to start at 18,772.76.
Trump 2.0: Impact on India's economy, trade and foreign investmentA second Trump term could alter India's economy, affecting trade tariffs and investment flows.

US elections: Tesla shares surge over 12% as Donald Trump winsThe sharp gains in Tesla shares were largely driven by investor sentiment around CEO Elon Musk's vocal support for Donald Trump throughout his campaign.

Sagility India IPO Day 2: Check Latest GMP, subscription details and moreSagility India IPO: Leading brokerages such as Nirmal Bang, BP Equities, Marwadi Shares & Finance Ltd, Ventura Securities Ltd, and Canara Bank have given a "Subscribe" rating for the IPO, citing Sagility's strong financial performance.
Tesla shares rise 12% after Trump's victoryPost Donald Trump's US election win with Elon Musk's backing, Tesla shares saw a 12% pre-market climb.

Donald Trump wins US elections: What it means for Indian stock market, economyWith Donald Trump back in power, India's economy and stock market could see significant shifts. Find out which sectors to watch and where to invest as global trends evolve.

US elections: Sensex, Nifty surge after Donald Trump claims victoryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 900.50 points to settle at 80,378.13, while the Nifty50 surged 270.75 points to 24,484.05. Earlier in the session, the Sensex had surged over 1,000 points.

Sensex surges over 1,000 points as Donald Trump claims victory in US electionsUS elections: Donald Trump has already declared victory, and his win appears to have fuelled optimism on Dalal Street as Sensex has surged over 1,000 points.

Swiggy IPO Day 1: Check subscription details, GMP, and should you subscribe?Swiggy IPO: Bengaluru-based Swiggy opened for public subscription within a price band of Rs 371 to Rs 390 and people will be able to place their bids till November 8.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Congress takes BJP fire over 'blank' copies of Constitution at Rahul Gandhi eventThe colour of the copy of the Constitution carried by Rahul Gandhi also became a point of contention, with Devendra Fadnavis saying it indicated an inclination towards "urban Naxals and anarchists."

Man whose phone was used to threaten SRK had filed complaint against actorDuring questioning by the police, Faizan Khan claimed that he had nothing to do with the threatening call made to Shah Rukh Khan and that someone might be trying to frame him.

India stops consular camps in Canada, says lack of basic securityDays after a violent Khalistani mob stormed the premises of a Hindu temple in Canada's Brampton and attacked devotees, the Indian High Commission in Canada has decided to cancel some of the planned consular camps. The Indian Counsulate General in Toronto said that the Canadian authorities refused even "minimum security protection" for such camps.

'Selective amnesia': Royal scions pan Rahul Gandhi for 'pliant maharajas' remarkRahul Gandhi, in an op-ed, said the East India Company choked India by partnering with, bribing, and threatening pliant maharajas and nawabs. The remark was condemned by several members of the erstwhile royal families.

MF Husain designed Shalini Passi's wedding cards, but on one conditionIn an exclusive interview, Shalini Passi revealed that her husband's family, who were close to legendary artist MF Husain, asked him to design their wedding invitations - and he had one special request before proceeding.

'Magnificent man', 'My friend': What PM Modi-Trump bromance bodes for tiesModi-Trump bromance: PM Narendra Modi was one of the first leaders to congratulate Donald Trump and one of the first to have a call with the President-elect after the Republican won the US poll race for the White House.

Jet Airways grounded for good as Supreme Court orders liquidationThe Supreme Court noted that five years had passed since the plan was approved, and there had been no significant progress in reviving the airline.

More than dosti? Elon Musk in Trump family's victory photoThe Trump family photo shared by Kai Trump and captioned "the whole squad" featured Elon Musk in the frame, sparking speculation about the billionaire's close ties to the President-elect.

Go, Goa and gone. Foreign tourist arrivals drop by 60% in big worryOnce a bustling hub for international travellers, Goa is now grappling with a sharp decline in foreign tourist numbers since the pandemic. While domestic tourism has seen an uptick, foreign arrivals, particularly from key markets like Russia, Israel, and the UK, remain significantly lower.

From 'Deplorables' to Dominance: How Trump secured the 2024 electionEthnic identity groups that never traditionally backed the Republican Party have started voting in large numbers for it. That's something similar to India where the BJP has transitioned from being a Brahmin-Baniya party to one of OBCs and tribals.

Centre doubles fines for stubble burning as Delhi, other areas battle pollutionUnder the new rules, which take effect immediately, farmers with less than two acres of land will face a fine of Rs 5,000. Those with between two and five acres will be fined Rs 10,000.

What Rahul did to Modi, Harris failed to do to Trump. Here's whyIn 2024, both India and the US saw similar election issues with opposite outcomes. While opposition leader Rahul Gandhi skilfully used narratives to challenge the formidable NDA of Narendra Modi, Democrat Kamala Harris failed to do so against Donald Trump.

Indian-origin woman buys house where Matthew Perry died, performs puja. Pics, videoThe Los Angeles house that Anita Verma-Lallian bought for $8.55 million was where Matthew Perry lived and was found dead in 2023.

Ali Fazal reveals daughter's name, talks about 'serious anxiety' as a new parentRicha Chadha and Ali Fazal revealed their daughter's name, Zuneyra Ida Fazal. Richa talked about trusting her instincts as a mother while Ali shared his overwhelming joy and anxiety as a new parent.

'4 sh*tposters vs Kamala Harris's 100': Meet Trump's social media crack teamIn the aftermath of his election victory, President-elect Donald Trump's social media team is basking in the success of their online strategy and has also taken a parting shot at Vice President Kamala Harris.

Citadel Honey Bunny X review: Fans praise Raj and DK's craft, Samantha-Varun shineSamantha and Varun Dhawan's Citadel Honey Bunny is streaming on Prime Video. Soon after the spy-thriller premiered on OTT, fans showered their love on the series.

How to do an anti-inflammatory diet for weight loss like Vidya Balan, Samantha?An anti-inflammatory diet focusses on foods that help reduce inflammation in the body while avoiding those that may trigger it.

Why Sabarimala pilgrimage is a kid-glove affair for Pinarayi govt every yearThe annual pilgrimage begins from November 16 amid discontent over a cap on the number of devotees and memories of protests over women of menstrual age being allowed darshan

Chaos in J&K assembly as Engineer Rashid's brother shows banner on Article 370The chaos ensued after BJP leader and Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly, Sunil Sharma objected to the display of the banner by Khurshid Ahmad Sheikh, an Awami Ittehad Party MLA representing the Langate constituency.

Bengaluru bus driver dies of heart attack while driving, conductor stops vehicleA 39-year-old BMTC driver, died of cardiac arrest while driving a bus near Yeshwantpur. As he collapsed, the bus grazed another BMTC vehicle, but the quick-thinking conductor swiftly brought it to a stop.

Rishi Sunak, wife Akshata Murty go on temple visit, make cafe stop in Bengaluru Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife, Akshata Murty, were spotted at a coffee shop in Bengaluru enjoying their time together.

Watch: Allah Ghazanfar's spin wizardry makes Bangladesh lose 8 wickets for 23 runsAfghanistan's off-spinner Allah Ghazanfar ran through Bangladesh batting during the first ODI against Bangladesh on Wednesday, November 6 in Sharjah.

Bangladeshi forces crack down on Hindus in Chittagong after post sparks unrestTensions flared in Chittagong over a social media post by a member of the Islamic radical group Jamat-e-Islami, which contained objectionable content against ISKCON and the Hindu religion.

Waqf row: Parliament panel chief visits Karnataka amid BJP's land jihad chargeWaqf Bill parliamentary panel chief Jagdambika Pal is in Karnataka on a solo "fact-finding" mission to address concerns from local farmers alleging their land was improperly claimed as Waqf property.

Pics: Actor and Bigg Boss Tamil contestant Pradeep Antony gets marriedActor and Bigg Boss Tamil 7 contestant Pradeep Antony got married to Pooja Shakthi on November 7. They had two ceremonies, according to Hindu and Christian customs.

Arjun Kapoor reveals he suffers from an autoimmune disorder, mild depressionActor Arjun Kapoor recently revealed that he suffers from Hashimoto's Thyroiditis, an autoimmune disorder. In a recent interview, he also opened up about his struggles with mild depression and other physical, emotional, and mental challenges.

Photography to learning musical instruments: Kamal Haasan's passion beyond cinemaAs Kamal Haasan turns 70, let us explore his passion for hobbies that are beyond cinema. From learning dance and photography to exploring new musical instruments, he is constantly evolving as an artiste.

Varun Tej on Konidela-Allu family dynamics: Chiranjeevi is headmasterTelugu actor Varun Tej, while promoting his upcoming film Matka, opened about his dynamics with cousins Ram Charan and Allu Arjun and how his uncle Chiranjeevi has played the central figure in the Konidela-Allu family.

sports.headline: WPL Retention 2025 LIVE: Focus on Gujarat Giants, RCB, Mumbai IndiansWPL 2025 Retention Live Updates: Royal Challengers Bengaluru is in focus as all the five teams will look to finalise their initial set of players for the upcoming edition. Gujarat Giants will look for a complete overhaul after they failed to qualify for the playoffs in both seasons.

Ricky Ponting suggests Babar Azam to take Virat Kohli's route to regain formLegendary Australia captain Ricky Ponting has suggested Pakistan star Babar Azam to stay away from the game for some time like Virat Kohli to regain form.

IPL 2025: AB de Villiers lists 4 targets for RCB, calls for Yuzi Chahal returnIPL 2025 mega auction: Legendary AB de Villiers urged Royal Challengers Bengaluru to spend big money on Yuzvendra Chahal, R Ashwin, Kagiso Rabada and Bhuvneshwar Kumar. RCB head into the mega auction with the second-biggest purse of Rs 83 crore.

Greg Chappell pens letter to struggling Prithvi: 'Don't hesitate to reach out' Prithvi Shaw, 24, has been going through a difficult phase in his career. The Mumbai batter was dropped from the Ranji Trophy squad due to fitness and disciplinary issues. Legendary Greg Chappell wrote to Prithvi, urging him to find courage to bounce back from the setbacks.

Pat Cummins wary of 'dangerous' Rishabh Pant: He moves the game on pretty quicklyAustralia captain Pat Cummins hailed wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant ahead of the five-match Test series against India mentioning his ability to move the game quickly.

Inconsistent Sanju Samson will be in focus on South Africa tour: Anil KumbleFocus will be on Sanju Samson when India play South Africa in the 4-match T20I series, feels Anil Kumble. Samson hit a terrific hundred in the previous series against Bangladesh while opening the batting for India.

AUS-A vs IND-A: Jurel shines, KL Rahul fails as Australia hold edge on Day 1On a challenging Day 1, Dhruv Jurel's fighting knock of 80 was the only highlight for India-A as they were bowled out for 161 by Australia-A. KL Rahul and the rest of the Indian top order had an outing to forget.

Inter got a penalty in the dying moments of the first half and converted it to seal the win.

Neeraj Chopra sends emotional message to retiring coach Klaus BartonietzIn a heartfelt message and video, Neeraj Chopra announced that he would be seperating from his longtime coach Klaus Bartonietz, who will be heading back to Germany and retire. Bartonietz oversaw Neeraj's meteoric rise in javelin throw.

Australia's Raygun retires from breaking after Olympics 2024 performance backlashRachael Gunn, also known as B-girl Raygun, has announced her retirement from competitive breaking following a viral backlash over her Paris Olympics performance. The scrutiny and criticism have led her to reconsider her future in the sport.

WI vs ENG: Carty, King hit hundreds as West Indies seal series with 8-wicket winWest Indies defeated England by eight wickets, securing a 2-1 series victory. Keacy Carty and Brandon King's centuries led a commanding chase under the Kensington Oval lights.
Pant's emotional message on coach's death anniversary: His legacy inspires usRishabh Pant shared an emotional message as he paid tribute to his childhood coach on his death anniversary.

Allah Ghazanfar stars as Afghanistan take 1-0 lead vs Bangladesh in ODI seriesAllah Ghazanfar starred on his debut with a six-wicket haul as Afghanistan beat Bangladesh by 92 runs in the 1st ODI. Afghanistan took 1-0 lead in the ODI series in Sharjah.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
